meanings.definition: A person who enjoys listening to or dancing to pop music.
meanings.sent1: The boppers at the concert were singing along to every song.
meanings.sent2: She is known as a bopper because she loves pop music.
meanings.sent3: The boppers at the party were showing off their dance moves.
meanings.sent4: The boppers lit up the dance floor with their energetic moves.
meanings.sent5: The boppers' enthusiasm for pop music was contagious to everyone around them.

meanings.definition: A type of headwear worn for protection during boxing or other contact sports.
meanings.sent1: The boxer put on his boppers before stepping into the ring.
meanings.sent2: The athletes always wear their boppers during intense matches.
meanings.sent3: The boppers looked funny on the fighters, but they were essential for safety.
meanings.sent4: The boppers shielded the boxer's head from powerful punches.
meanings.sent5: The bright red boppers stood out in the boxing arena, ensuring safety for the fighters.

meanings.definition: A type of toy or novelty item that makes a noise when shaken or moved.
meanings.sent1: The children were delighted by the sound of the boppers as they played.
meanings.sent2: She bought a set of boppers for her toddler to enjoy.
meanings.sent3: The boppers entertained the kids with their cheerful jingles.
meanings.sent4: The boppers chimed happily as the children shook them around.
meanings.sent5: The colorful boppers added a musical element to the playtime, bringing joy to the kids.
